title: Are all the Harry Potter books in sequence? Do I have to read the first book so I can understand the second one? - Quora

response.answer_text: YEAH! It’s a series indeed. That means you have to read them in order. BUT I didn’t do it. It’s because I watched the movies first from the first one to the last one. THEN, I read the books. As long as you’ve watched the movies, you can read them in any way you want. (You’ll still be able to understand the plot as clear as crystal, trust me) I read the seventh one first, then third, then fifth, then sixth, and then fourth. I haven’t even read the first and second one. I will, though, one day.

You could jump around in the series if you wanted, I suppose. But a writer creates a series to be consumed in order. It’s a gradual unfolding and progression. Rowling is particularly good at making tiny, seemingly unimportant details in the early books actually HUGE for the plot in later books. Read the series (and any series) however you want. But the story won’t unfold as it was intended, so you might lose something in the development. I would at least not read books 5–7 before you read a couple of the first 4. Since the first 4 have an entirely different tone from the last.

Yes, you need to read them in order - The Harry Potter series covers Harry’s life (and the events in the magical world in which he lives) from shortly before his 11th birthday until spring of his 17th year. If someone wrote a book series about your life, one book for each year, I imagine you would agree that reading the book about say, your sophmore year in high school, followed by 3rd grade, followed by the year you got married - it simply wouldn’t make sense.

Yes of course! Not only will reading them in order make more sense, but you will be much more fulfilled and satisfied with the character plot lines once you've gotten all the necessary background info you need from novel to novel! I extremely recommend reading the books in order. Otherwise you will have questions!

Yes.. They are all in sequence... You can read them in their original order and leave reading them after a while, if you don't like them. But you cannot read them without the order... You simply won't understand each of the little incidents and their significance.... Read them in their order, if you decide reading... :).

Although it is advisable to go in sequence, you don’t necessarily have to. HP is so ingrained in the Social Media verse and the books are written in such a way, that one will not feel lost by starting in the middle. The sequence I read in: 3 -> 4 -> 5 ->6 -> 7 -> 2 -> 1

Skipping the first book or not reading it first, might get you confused a lot, unless you already watched the movies. However; I strongly recommend you read them in order, so you do not get lost and confused with the characters build up and story lines. Enjoy your reading! :D

Yes, it’s better if you read it in sequence because every trouble Harry and his friends get in is supported by a strong background story. Each book is connected with other in such a way that even if you skip one book you might be missing out on big plot. Trust me and start reading it because it’s totally worth it.

You need to understand something first. The series is all about Harry Potter growing up into a full fledged wizard through his 7 years at Hogwarts. So, you might choose to skip one or more of the books, but that would be like missing out on an entire year of his life. Rest, is up to you.
Yes, you need to read them in sequence; OotP, HBP and DH in particular assume that you’ve read all the previous books.
Yes..... They follow him from ages 11 to 18
